alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 12:04AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...An area of heavy snow will affect Oxford...Somerset...Franklin... Coos and northeastern Carroll Counties... At 1202 AM EST...A band of heavy snow was along a line extending from the Champlain Valley of Vermont northward into Quebec...and moving southeast AT 35 MPH. Locations impacted include... Berlin, Farmington, Lancaster, Fryeburg, Bethel, Bethlehem, Colebrook, Jackman, Eustis, Coburn Gore, Rangeley, Rumford, Madison, Jay, Dixfield, Kingfield, Canton, Bingham, Andover and Carrabassett Valley. This also includes... Crawford Notch State Park, Umbagog Lake State Park, First Connecticut Lake, Kilkenny Ridge Trail, and Mount Jefferson. * Winds in excess of 30 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a quarter mile in this area of heavy snow. Icy roads are possible as the snow melts on the roads then quickly refreezes.

area.areaDesc: Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Southern Coos
